metadata.title: CVE-2019-12970 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
XSS was discovered in SquirrelMail through 1.4.22 and 1.5.x through 1.5.2.Due to improper handling of RCDATA and RAWTEXT type elements, the built-insanitization mechanism can be bypassed. Malicious script content from HTMLe-mail can be executed within the application context via crafted use of(for example) a NOEMBED, NOFRAMES, NOSCRIPT, or TEXTAREA element.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12970` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

squirrelmail - 2:1.4.23~svn20120406-2+deb8u3ubuntu0.14.04.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: squirrelmail package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.4.23~svn20120406-2+deb8u3ubuntu0.14.04.1~esm1').
